meanings.definition: Not firmly or tightly fixed in place; detached or able to be detached.
meanings.sent1: The shirt was the loosest one I owned, hanging off my shoulders.
meanings.sent2: She wore the loosest pants, comfortable and airy on a hot day.
meanings.sent3: The loosest screw in the drawer always manages to roll away when needed.
meanings.sent4: His grip on reality felt as loosest as a kite string in a strong wind.
meanings.sent5: The loosest knot in the rope caused it to slip from his hands easily.

meanings.definition: Not fitting tightly; having extra space.
meanings.sent1: The loosest shoes she owned were perfect for long walks.
meanings.sent2: The loosest belt he had kept slipping down his waist.
meanings.sent3: The loosest glove on the team made catching the ball a challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her schedule was the loosest it had ever been, allowing for spontaneity.
meanings.sent5: The loosest lid on the jar made it difficult to keep the contents fresh.

meanings.sent1: The loosest rule in the house was 'be kind to others'.
meanings.sent2: His interpretation of the assignment was the loosest of all the students.
meanings.sent3: The loosest definition of success is simply being happy.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was the loosest bond, easily broken by misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The loosest timeline for the project allowed for creativity and exploration.
